data.title: Blue Shield of California Foundation
data.meta_description: We are committed to ending domestic violence and ensuring low-income residents have access to healthcare. Check out our grantmaking & impact across California.
data.text:
Grant Announcement

Foundation invests $3.6 million in key partners and strategies to prevent domestic violence and make California the healthiest state

“Our grantee partners are well positioned to bring equitable solutions to as many people and communities as possible, especially the communities of color with low incomes that are most affected by health inequity and domestic violence.”

— Debbie I. Chang, MPH, Foundation president & CEO

What We Do

Well-being for California communities

80% of health outcomes are not tied to health care — which is why we target root causes in our work to promote health equity and end domestic violence. We have carefully honed our strategies to focus on the following three areas:

Strengthen economic security and mobility

Break the cycle of domestic violence

Align systems with community priorities
